result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert C Barbre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation on 15CF480
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff Department as a condition of probation on 15CF0480.
Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence Credit for 1 day granted.  Defendant to keep the SCRAM bracelet on during his sentence.

Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Concurrent with:

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must petition the court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert C Barbre in court on huber status, with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Charges 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Simon makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:
20 days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 1 day).  
Defendant to keep the SCRAM bracelet on during his sentence.


FINE:  $1129.00 as a condition of probation on 15CF480
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff Department as a condition of probation on 15CF480.

DL REVOCATION:  18 months concurrent.  
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 18 months concurrent.  
Other:  AODA Assessment and follow through
Expunction is conditionally granted upon completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.  Defendant must Petition the Court in writing upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant Robert C Barbre in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Robert C Barbre in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas C Simon.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel, supervised by Timothy Westphal, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has been accepted into an IOP program and is awaiting responses from other programs regarding inpatient treatment.  Defense requests defendant be allowed Huber Bailee status for treatment purposes only.  Defendant is willing to also be placed on SCRAM monitoring.  Court grants defendant's request.  Court orders defendant to have Huber Bailee status for treatment purposes only and with installation of SCRAM immediately upon release for first treatment session.  Court will set this matter for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on June 17, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Robert C Barbre in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas C Simon.   Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has not been allowed to make the phone calls ordered by the court.  Clerk to contact the jail and ensure the defendant will be able to make those calls prior to the next hearing.  Defendant to decide on whether to have a preliminary hearing or waive the preliminary hearing at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 03:15 pm.
Hearing on June 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert C Barbre in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The jail received the order for the defendant to have extended phone calls and have informed him that they will allow him to start making those calls today.  State files an Amended Complaint.  This will change this case to a felony.  Defense acknowledges receipt of Criminal Complaint.  Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.
